people.name: MIGUEL ESTEBAN GUTIÉRREZ
people.desc: Software engineer working for the Center for Open Middleware and the Ontology Engineering Group. He is leading the development of LDP4j and is member of the W3C Linked Data Platform Working Group.

people.name: NANDANA MIHINDUKULASOORIYA
people.desc: Software engineer working for Center for Open Middleware and Ontology Engineering Group. He is also a member of the W3C Linked Data Platform working group and serves as the editor of the LDP 1.0 Primer.

people.name: RAÚL GARCIA CASTRO
people.desc: Assistant Professor at Universidad Politécnica de Madrid and works in the Ontology Engineering Group in several European and Spanish research projects. He is also a member of the W3C Linked Data Platform working group and has participated in the definition of the W3C LDP Test Cases.

people.name: ASUNCIÓN GÓMEZ-PÉREZ
people.desc: Full Professor at the Universidad Politécnica de Madrid (UPM) and director of the Ontology Engineering Group based at the Computer Science School at UPM.

people.name: FERNANDO SERENA
people.desc: Software engineer working for Center for Open Middleware and Ontology Engineering Group. He has been involved in the definition of the W3C LDP Test Cases and in the development of this website.

inst.name: Center for Open Middleware
inst.desc: The Center for Open Middleware (COM) is  a collaboration between Universidad Politécnica de Madrid and Banco Santander. They devise an open, self-sustained, innovation-fostering, software ecosystem around middleware. COM is the incubator of this open ecosystem: turns ideas into innovation and organize agents to keep this innovation alive.

inst.name: Ontology Engineering Group
inst.desc: The Ontology Engineering Group (OEG) is based at the Computer Science School at Universidad Politécnica de Madrid (UPM). It ranks eighth among the two hundred research groups from UPM and it is widely recognised in Europe in the areas of Ontology Engineering, Semantic Infrastructure, Linked Data, and Data Integration. Our main research areas are: Ontological Engineering, (Social) Semantic Web and Linked Data, Natural Language, Semantic e-Science and the Future Internet.
